availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Collins D. Bradley (Trigg County, Kentucky, attorney, circuit judge, and commonwealth's attorney.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, attorney, circuit judge, and commonwealth's attorney. Virginia native. Married to Virginia Waddill Bradley in Trigg County, Kentucky, on December 25, 1832. Married to Mary J. Fisher Jenkins Bradley in Trigg County on May 21, 1850. Father of William G. Bradley, Daniel H. Bradley, and Anna Bradley. Stepfather of Frances A. Jenkins and Margaret A. Jenkins. Attorney in Trigg County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. County attorney for Trigg County in 1851. Circuit judge for the Second Judicial District of Kentucky in 1854. Attorney in Trigg County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1860. Commonwealth's attorney pro tempore for the Second Judicial District of Kentucky in 1860.
